definition: abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]
to enjoy the confidence of the people/to be very popular
not living up to expectations (idiom)/failing to inspire confidence among people/unpopular

sentences.english: The Rockets were a popular choice to make the Western Conference finals when the season began.
sentences.chinese: 赛季初的时候，火箭是众望所归的西部决赛球队。

sentences.english: The fuel battery become one of way solves this cause in many customers mind.
sentences.chinese: 要突破这样的瓶颈，燃料电池就成了众望所归。

sentences.english: His film performance didn't live up to our expectations.
sentences.chinese: 他在影片中的表演有负众望。

sentences.english: One man, Heracles of Athens emerged as its undisputed leader.
sentences.chinese: 一个名叫赫拉克利斯的人众望所归成为雅典领袖。

sentences.english: You are win popular with masses.
sentences.chinese: 你人缘好人气旺赢得众望。

sentences.english: He came to office only six weeks ago, offering hope.
sentences.chinese: 6周以前，他深孚众望，走马上任。

sentences.english: Cooperation between the two countries in the domain of fine art has also been greatly anticipated by many.
sentences.chinese: 可以说两国之间艺术上的合作也是众望所归。

sentences.english: Changes in the office property market is facing anti-fever favor with the market?
sentences.chinese: 楼市退烧市场面临盘整房价变动是众望所归？

sentences.english: Therefore choosing Hetian jade as national stone will gai…
sentences.chinese: 因此，和田玉被选为国石是众望所归。

sentences.english: On Tuesday in the team finals, the team delivered.
sentences.chinese: 本周二的团队决赛让他们成为众望所归。

sentences.english: The Chinese men dominated on their home soil, as expected.
sentences.chinese: 中国男子体操队不负众望在本土取得霸主地位。

sentences.english: The reconstruction of Ying garden is a great event in the garden circle of China, and enjoys popular confidence.
sentences.chinese: 影园复建是园林界的大事，是众望所归之举。

sentences.english: The soldier's performance of his duties was as good as one might expect.
sentences.chinese: 这位士兵不负众望，出色地履行了自己的职责。

sentences.english: In the hope of so many people, you did not let us down.
sentences.chinese: 在这么多人的希冀下，你不负众望。

sentences.english: He was once the great white hope of the Party.
sentences.chinese: 他一度是党中深孚众望的人。

definition: not living up to expectations (idiom)/failing to inspire confidence among people/unpopular
worthy of pride/impressive/enviable/to show contempt for others
to continue the struggle (idiom); to persist/unremitting efforts
(honorific) your kind efforts/thanks to your help
to advance boldly/to push ahead vigorously
